abstract.t: QUIC's congestion control is not designed for operating over an Internet path with a high BDP. This limits the user experience. Moreover, a path can combine satellites network segment together with a wide variety of other network technologies (Ethernet, cable modems, WiFi, cellular, radio links, etc): this complicates the characteristics of the end-to-end path. If this is not addressed, the end-to-end quality of experience will be degraded. This memo identifies the characteristics of a SATCOM link that impact the operation of the QUIC transport protocol and proposes current practice to ensure acceptable protocol performance.
